name: Thai Pomelo Salad
instructions: Peel the pomelo as you would an orange, keeping only the flesh (as whole as possible)without any membranes.
Half or quarter the cherry tomatoes, slice the scallions and the whole cilantro bunch -toss together with the pomelo.
Combine the ingredients for the dressing and pour over the salad - toss well but becareful not to break the pomelo too much.
Before serving, you can sprinkle the unsalted roasted peanuts - slightly crushed over thesalad. I personally do not care for peanuts, but friends love the balance it brings to thedish.

name: Glass Noodle Salad
instructions: Soak the vermicelli in hot water till its transparent and then strain it.

Slice onions, tomatoes, celery and chilies. Cut broccoli into florets, baby corn length wise and julienne the carrots. Blanch the broccoli and baby corn in hot boiling water, one by one and then dunk them into ice cold water.
Mix together all the ingredients and add seasoning to taste.
Serve on a bed of lettuce, garnish with mint leaves.

name: Raw Mango Salad
instructions: Peel the raw mangoes and grate them. Then, slice the onions.
Toss the rest of the ingredients together with the raw mangoes and onions.
Add crushed peanuts and serve it on a bed of lettuce.

name: Tom Zaab Gai
ingredients: 10 gm chicken leg boneless        10 gm lemon grass
instructions: Take 100 grams of chicken thigh boneless, clean it properly and cut it into small dices and keep it aside.
Take 3 pieces of kaffir lime leaf, one lemon grass stick, one fresh red chili and clean it properly,  cut in to small slices and keep it aside.
Take a soup pan and add two cups of stock, bring it to boil and then add chicken, lemon grass, kaffir lime leaf and fresh red chili .
Bring it to boil for 3 minutes. Add  fish sauce and lemon juice. Add seasoning as per the taste.
Serve in a bowl, garnish it with mint leaf and roasted sticky rice.

name: Hot Basil Chicken Cups
ingredients: 5 gm fresh red chili finely chopped
Iceberg lettuce, leaves made into 6 cups
instructions: Heat oil (on a high flame) in a wok add garlic, onion and fresh red chili.
Toss until garlic is cooked and add boneless chicken, toss well.
Add oyster sauce, fish sauce, light soya sauce, and sugar.
Cook until chicken is done and water has dried out.
Add dry basil, toss well, add fresh basil and remove from heat
Serve placed in the 6 lettuce cups.
If you keep the lettuce cups in iced water, in the fridge they will stay crisp. Drain well and dry with kitchen paper before using

name: Chicken with Chillies & Cashews
ingredients: 200 gm boneless chicken flattened and sliced very thin and long
2 spring onions cut in 2.5 cm pieces
instructions: Heat 1 Tbsp oil in a wok. Stir fry chillies till cooked but not burnt. Remove and keep aside.
Stir fry garlic in the remaining oil until golden.
Add chicken slices, oyster and fish sauces, sugar and roasted chilli paste. Stir fry until chicken is cooked.
Lower the heat.  Add stock and cook 2-3 minutes stirring.
Add cashews, nuts, spring onion white, red chillies and capsicum when the chicken is thoroughly cooked. Stir well.
Garnish with green spring onion and serve hot.

name: Prawn and Pork on Sugarcane Sticks
ingredients: 2 sugarcane sticks - cut into 4 inch pieces
Medium sized prawns - shelled and De-veined
instructions: Peel sugar cane.
Grind prawns, pork, onion, and garlic, sugar, and coriander, fish sauce, seasoning lemon grass until smooth. Bind the mix with egg.
Using well oiled hands mold 1 Tbsp of the mixture around each sugarcane stick, leaving 1 end uncovered.
Deep fry in hot oil for 3-4 minutes till golden brown.
Drain and serve with accompaniments.
For the sauce:
Combine all the ingredients except chilli. Allow it to stand for 15 minutes. Strain and stir in the chilli.
Serve with the prawn and pork sticks.

name: Thai Fish Curry
instructions: Marinate the fish cubes in half of the Thai green curry paste.
Add salt, pepper,lemon juice and set aside.
Heat some oil in a pan, add the onions, ginger, garlic and sweat for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the rest of the green curry paste and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
Then add the coconut milk and the fish cubes. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add the chopped coriander, lemon juice and palm sugar.
Garnish with basil leaves. Serve with steamed rice.

name: Thai Green Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat the oil and add the onions, Saute till they soft.
Add the curry paste and stir fry to mix well.
Add chicken pieces, saute over high heat till opaque.
Add water and cook till chicken is tender.
Add the coconut milk, lime leaves, basil leaves and lemon grass and bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and simmer for 3-4 minutes and serve hot with boiled rice on the side.

name: Raw Papaya Salad
instructions: Add some grated papaya to a bowl.
Add a Tbsp of lemon juice. Then add some fried peanuts to the mixture.
Add coriander, red chillies and chilli sauce.
Mix all the ingredients together and serve chilled.

name: Papaya Salad
ingredients: 1 Tbsp lemon juice or to taste
instructions: Take a bowl, add finely peeled and grated papaya to it.
Then add salt and pepper for taste.
Add chopped onions, ginger and green chillies.
Then add soya sauce and lemon juice.  Mix all the ingredients well.
Chill and transfer on to a serving bowl, garnish with roasted peanuts, coriander leaves and serve.

name: Thai Steamed Fish
instructions: Thai marinade paste:
Put all the ingredients in a grinder and grind all together.
Finish it off with lemon juice and keep aside.
For the steam fish:1. Smother oil on a silver foil and add Thai marinade paste on it.
Lay some fresh beans over the top and lay marinated fish over it.
Nicely foil it all together giving a little space over the top.
Put it in a preheat oven and cook away for 10-12 minutes at 200 degrees.
Serve it on a platter.

name: Stir Fried Prawns
instructions: For the stir fried prawns:
Drizzle olive oil in a preheated pan and add the prawns and stir-fry.
Take out the prawns when it turns golden brown.
Heat the pan again and drizzle oil and add ginger, spring onion, red chili and fennel seeds.
Cook it all together.
Add the fried prawns into the pan and saute it.
Add sweet chili sauce, soya sauce, lemon juice, cucumber and coriander and mix them all together. Cook it away for 2 minutes.
Serve it in a platter with noodles.
For the noodles:
Bring the water to a boil.
Add the plain noodles and a pinch of salt. Once it has cooked filter the water.
Add some refined oil and chopped coriander leaves and chopped spring onions.
Serve it in a platter.

name: Khao Klukh Krapi (Rice with Shrimp Paste)
instructions: Cook  the  rice. Peel  the  prawns  and  cut  it  into  small  pieces.
Pour  oil  into  the  wok, add  garlic, chilli paste and stir till garlic becomes light brown.
Now add  chicken  and  prawns, stir till cook.
Add  shrimp  paste, fish sauce  and lemon  juice. Mix.
Add  rice  to  it.
Garnish  with  slices of omelet and cucumber.

name: Rockys Pad Thai
ingredients: 4 Tbsp palm sugar (or 2 Tbsp regular sugar)
6 Tbsp fish sauce or soy sauce
1 cup bean sprouts or chopped cabbage

Cabbage, Bean sprouts, Green onion, Coriander leaf, lime wedges, groud
 roasted peanuts and ground dried red chilly for garnish.
instructions: Soak noodles in lukewarm water for 10-15 minutes till soft.
Heat veg oil over low heat and fry the garlic and shallots till fragrant.
Add chicken/prawn or paneer and stir fry till cooked.
Break the eggs into the wok and mix well.
Add noodles, fish sauce, sugar, tamarind paste and stir until noodles are tender and well mixed.
Add bean sprouts and green onion while stirring constantly.
Serve topped with garnish.
Remember:
-    Do not under cook noodles or they will be rubbery.
-    If you overcook the noodles they will turn to mush.
-    Be generous with the tamarind, it is a great taste.
-    Serve hot and fresh, from wok to plate.

name: Som Tam (Papaya Salad)
ingredients: 2 Tbsp palm sugar (or 1 Tbsp regular sugar)
2 Tbsp fish sauce or soy sauce
Fresh lettuce, green beans, lime wedges and chilly for garnish
instructions: Peel and seed papaya and shred it. Put in a bowl.
Crush garlic with a pestle, then add long beans and tomatoes and pound a few times to release juices.
Add the chillies and crush lightly to release the heat.
In a separate cup dissolve the sugar in the lime juice and fish sauce.
Mix all ingredients together now and toss to mix.
Serve in a shallow bowl and top with garnish.
Remember:
Do not blend but use mortar and pestle for the salad.
Do not add salt, the fish sauce or soy sauce has enough salt.
Taste once mixed and add any ingredient to taste ..this one is supposed to be deadly spicy.

name: Gka Prow Gai (Basil Chicken)
instructions: Heat oil in pan till very hot.
Add garlic till brown, then onion, chilly paste and sugar.
As soon as onion turns transparent add the mince and cook till almost done.
Add a little water (30 ml) once it starts cooking well
Add the sauces (soy, oyster and fish) and the pepper.
When the mince is done add the basil leaves.
Serve hot.
Remember:
Cook the mince well before adding the sauces. (do not overcook)
Add the basil leaves right at the end and switch off heat as soon as you do, the leaves will taste better when fresh.
Serve fresh and eat with plain rice.

name: Thai Mango Salad
ingredients: 200 gms raw mango, peeled and grated
instructions: Toss mint, red chilli, palm sugar and light soya sauce with the raw mangoes and onions.
Top it with roasted peanuts and serve it on a bed of lettuce.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

instructions: Peel the pomelo as you would an orange, keeping only the flesh (as whole as possible)without any membranes.
Half or quarter the cherry tomatoes, slice the scallions and the whole cilantro bunch -toss together with the pomelo.
Combine the ingredients for the dressing and pour over the salad - toss well but becareful not to break the pomelo too much.
Before serving, you can sprinkle the unsalted roasted peanuts - slightly crushed over thesalad. I personally do not care for peanuts, but friends love the balance it brings to thedish.

name: Pla-E-Saan
instructions: Wash the sole fillet and pat it dry. Dust the slices with the tempura flour and deep fry. Keep it aside.
In a wok add palm sugar and stir till it melts, add fish sauce and chillies to it.
Now add the grated raw mango.
Pour the sauce over the batter fried fish and garnish with mint leaves. Serve.

name: Sticky Rice with Mango
instructions: Wash sticky rice and soak it for 8 hours. Put it in muslin cloth and steam it till half done.
Put coconut milk in a pot, add sugar and salt. Keep on stirring it on slow flame till it becomes a little thick.
When sticky rice is fully done, pack it with coconut milk, leaving 1 tbsp of coconut milk aside for garnishing.
Peel the mango and dice it.
Put sticky rice in a small mould. De-mould it onto a plate. Garnish with a tbsp of coconut milk and sesame seeds.
Serve it with dices of mango.
cook_time: 1 Hour 15 Minutes + Time to soak rice

name: Nahm Jim Steamed Fish
ingredients: 1 Tbsp fresh red chillies finely chopped
instructions:
For the Nahm Jim sauce: 
In a bowl add the lemon juice, fish sauce, sugar. Mix well to dissolve the sugar.
Now add the garlic, chillies, coriander ( do not gorget to add the coriander roots and they have a lot of flavor in them).
Add the kaffir leaves and water. Mix well.
Keep aside.
For the fish:
Marinate fish fillet with fish sauce, chopped galangal, chopped lemon grass, kafir lime leaves for about 15-20 minutes)
Put them in a steamer till cooked.
Heat the Nahm Jim dressing with a bit of water till a slight boil (we do not have to reduce the sauce).
Pour over fish. Garnish with basil, kafir lime leaves or coriander leaves.
For the Chilli Oil Dressing:
Heat oil, add red chillies and pour over the fish and serve.
Tip: The Nahm Jim sauce can also be used as a dressing for a nice cold salad.

name: Hot Yellow Curry with Vegetables
ingredients: 1 Tbsp fresh turmeric chopped  (you can use powdered turmeric also)
1 Tbsp fresh galangal chopped  (a young ginger root with a distinct flavor)
1/2 tsp fresh red chillies finely chopped
1/2 tsp salt        A pinch of sugar
instructions: Heat oil in a wok, and then add turmeric, chopped galangal, lemongrass, chillies and saute.
Add evaporated milk & a just a little bit of water (1/4 cup) to thin the curry and let it boil.
Season with salt, sugar and cook till dissolved well.
Remove from heat and let it cool.
Saute vegetables with some oil and garlic in another pan.
Add the pinch of salt and let it saute for a couple of minutes.
Now add the curry & bring to boil. Cover it and let it simmer for 7 - 8 minutes till the vegetables cook.
Serve hot.

name: Chicken And Tofu Satay
ingredients: 1/2 small bowl diced red and yellow bell peppers
instructions: For the marinade:
Mix all the ingredients together in a paste form.
For the satay:
Marinate the chicken in one bowl.
Marinate the tofu pieces and bell peppers in one.
Refrigerate for 15-20 minutes.
Skewer it and barbeque till done while basting with some oil in between.
For the peanut sauce:
In a pan add oil, garlic, peanuts. Saute.
Add turmeric, red chilli powder, sugar, fish sauce and coconut milk.
Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Serve with the satay.

name: Thai Fish Cakes with Cucumber Relish
ingredients: A handful of french beans, chopped fine
1 tsp kaffir lime, chopped very fine
instructions: For the fish cakes:
Pound the fish in a large bowl. Add some garlic to it.
Throw in the beans, pound and mix togethar.
Mix in the chillies now, while you continue pounding.
Add the red curry paste and kaffir lime now. Mix again.
In another bowl, beat an egg very delicately.
Now add half of the beaten egg and mix well with a spoon.
Season with salt, pepper and sugar.
Check the consistency if it's too dry you can add the other half of the beaten egg.
Now shape flattened round balls (like a pattie) of out this mixture.
Dab some oil to keep them nice and moist.
Pour some oil in a pan and fry these fish cakes.
Once they turn golden brown take them out on an absorbent paper.
For the cucumber relish:
Heat up the vinegar and sugar in a pan.
Let it boil for about 3-5 minutes. Let it some to a thickish consistency.
Once done, take it off the heat and pour it over the cucumbers. Add the crushed peanuts to the same bowl.
Add the kaffir lime to it.
Add the fish sauce. Mix all well.
Serve with the fish cakes.

name: Thai Noodle Soup
instructions: Let the chicken stock simmer on low heat for about one and a half hours.
Once done, strain the liquid in another pan and put it over heat again.
Add the spices to this chicken broth.
Add the green chillies, lime juice, fish sauce.
Then throw in the broccoli. (You can add any vegetables that you like)
Add the chicken and a pinch of sugar. Mix well and let it simmer.
While the chicken cooks, in another pan, heat some olive oil and add the garlic. Fry the garlic till it becomes brown.
Once the garlic is done, drain it on an absorbent paper. Garlic burns really fast so be careful not to burn it.
Add the coconut milk to the soup. And leave it to simmer.
In the meanwhile, toast (dry roast) the coconut powder.
Once done keep it aside. (It's done when it browns)
Now add the vermicelli to it.
Check if the chicken is cooked.
If it is pour the soup out into the bowls.
Garnish it with the peanuts, fried garlic, scallions and the roasted coconut.

name: Thai Basil Chicken
ingredients: 250 gm chicken, cut into small bite sized pieces
instructions: In a wok add olive oil, chillies and garlic. Saute.
Add the chicken. Saute for 2-3 minutes. Add a little bit water to de glaze.
Add oyster sauce, fish sauce and soy sauce. Toss.
Add the yellow and rec bell peppers with salt according to taste. Saute till chicken and bell peppers are cooked.
Just before the stir fry is ready add some basil leaves.
Serve with steamed rice.

name: Thai Pork Salad
ingredients: A pinch of pepper and sugar
instructions: Slice the pork pieces. Mix it with a little bit for sesame oil (1 tsp), salt and pepper (1/2 tsp).
Heat some oil in a pan and saute the garlic. Throw in the sliced onions. And finally add the pork. Pork cooks really fast.
Add some fish sauce to it and saute for a while.
In a bowl add the lettuce (cut into halves), avocado, cucumber, shallots, jalapenos, spring onions, a pinch of salt and bell peppers.
Now add to the veggies the dressing ingredients.
Finally add the pork.

name: Catfish And Raw Mango Salad
ingredients: For the Salad:2 green mangoes, grated
10-15 cashew nuts, roasted and crushed coarsely
instructions: Apply some slat and pepper to the fish fillets and cut them into cubes. Deep fry till golden-brown.
In a bowl mix grated raw green mangoes, chilli powder, lemon juice, sugar, shallots and fish sauce. Toss well.
Add the deep fried fish and cashews. Toss and serve.

name: Spicy Sriracha Prawns with Basil
ingredients: 10-12 medium sized prawns, deveined and deshelled
instructions: Heat oil in a wok and fry garlic and chillies.
Add prawns and stir fry.
Add oyster sauce, fish sauce and sriracha.
Cook till sauce coats prawns. If too dry add little water. Add basil leaves.
Squeeze lemon juice and serve with spring onion greens.

name: Satay Gai (Oriental Chicken Satay)
ingredients: 4 chicken breast or thigh, thinly sliced
1 small piece lemon grass, thinly sliced
1 tsp oil, to cook the chicken
instructions: In a mortar pound coriander root, salt and pepper and garlic.
In a bowl add palm sugar, fish sauce, curry powder, sesame oil, oyster sauce, soy sauce and coconut milk. Mix well and add chicken and marinate 1/2 hour.
Chop the shallot and lemon grass and galangal very finely and add to the marinade.
In a non stick pan put little oil. Skewer chicken strips and add to pan. Brown both sides and serve with peanut sauce.

name: Thai Chicken Yellow Curry
instructions: Heat oil in wok. Add garlic. Saute till fragrant. Add curry paste and saute for 2 minutes.
Add chicken. Saute till 25 percent cooked. Add coconut milk (thin). Mix well.
Bring to boil. Reduce heat and add onion, aubergines, pea aubergines, bamboo shoot and stock.
Season with fish sauce, salt, sugar, lemon juice. Add red chilly, thai ginger, lime leaf torn and lemon grass.
Adjust the seasoning and finish with basil leaves.
Serve hot.

name: Thai Soyabean In Cabbage Cups
instructions: Soak soya bean in water for at least half hour. Wash 3-4 times. Now squeeze them and take all water out.
In a wok, heat 1 tablespoon oil. Saute the chopped onion. Now add chopped garlic and green chillies.
Toss in soya bean. Saute till water dries.
Add the tomato sauce, soy sauce, Thai red curry paste and if not vegetarian , put in 1/2 chicken stock cube crumbled.
Add little crushed black pepper and saute. Now add spring onions and saute till crisp.
Add coriander spring onions, chilli flakes and few toasted peanuts .Taste for salt and squeeze lemon juice.
Serve with cabbage cups made out of small cabbage.

name: Chicken Satay
ingredients:
250 gm chicken supremes 
1 tsp ginger
1 tsp garlic 
A big pinch of turmeric
1 tsp soy sauce 
1 tsp red chilli paste 
1 tsp olive oil 
1 Lemon (juice) 
For the peanut sauce: 
1 cup peanuts (crushed coarsely)
1 medium onion 
1 tsp ginger 
1 stalk lemon grass (chopped) 
2 lime leaves
2 tsp oil 
1 tsp red chilli paste 
2 tsp jaggery 
1 cup coconut milk 
1/2 cup tamarind
Salt and pepper to taste
instructions: Marinate the chicken with all the ingredients. Thread them on to skewers.
And cook evenly on all sides.
For the peanut sauce:
In a pot, sweat off the onions, ginger, lemon grass, lime leaves.
Add in the crushed peanuts and the red chilli paste. Mix in the jaggery/palm sugar.
Finally add the coconut milk.
Simmer and blend. Season to taste.

name: Prawn Fried Rice
instructions: In a wok heat some oil until almost smoking.
Add the bacon, prawns and chicken. Saute.
Add the carrots, garlic and ginger.
Now add the sweet chilli sauce, soy sauce, salt, pepper, corn kernels and vinegar. Stir fry.
Add the cooked rice. Toss.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
Serve.

name: Mok Pla
instructions: Preheat a hot grill. Place the shallots and garlic between two sheets of kitchen foil.
Fold over the edge to seal and place this envelope under the hot grill.
Cook turning once, until the contents feel soft.
Unwrap the parcel and put the softened vegetables into a mortar together with the chilies. Pound to a paste.
Turn a paste into a mixing bowl, add the cod and break it up as you mix it with the paste.
Break the egg into the bowl, add the coconut cream and fish sauce and stir well. Add the basil leaves, stir once and set aside.
You now need to make banana leaf envelopes' in which the mixture will be steamed.
This container will be pyramid shaped and you will need two for this amount of filling.
For each pyramid, cut out a rectangle of banana leaf, Round off the narrow ends to make a long oval shape.
Place half the mixture at the center of each, carefully easing up the long sides so that any liquid is held in and encoring that these are slightly tucked in as you lift up.
Bring together the rounded ends, squeezing them to a point which you fasten with a toothpick and which give you your pyramids.
Go easy with the banana leaf which is fairly fragile and can simply crumble if forced too hard.
Place both pyramids in the upper compartment of a steamer and cook for 15 minutes.
Each dinner should have a pyramids which is opened at the table to release the pungent aroma of the steamed curry, which is scooped out and eaten in small amounts along with rice and other dishes.

name: Massaman Curry (Thai Muslim Curry)
ingredients: 1 thumb-size piece galangal (or ginger) - peeled and sliced
2 stalks lemongrass - outer leaves and bulb removed, then sliced thinly (save upper stems to throw into the pot )
instructions: Preheat the coconut milk over medium heat until boiling, add chicken thigh, reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes until tender.
Preheat the coconut cream over medium heat until oil surfaces.
Add the curry paste, and saute until fragrant. Transfer to the chicken pot, add peanuts.
Season to taste with sugar, fish sauce, tamarind juice and lime juice.
Add the remaining ingredients, and simmer until everything is tender and cooked through.
Spoon onto a serving dish, garnish with bay leaf to give a sense of a Thai touch. Pickled ginger or cucumber relish can also be served as condiments.
For Massaman Curry Paste
Place all paste ingredients in a food processor (or blender) and process well.
To make a sauce rather than a paste, add more coconut milk (1 to 2 cans).
To use immediately, place sauce in a casserole/baking dish together with chicken, seafood, vegetables.
Stir well to combine, and bake in the oven at 350 degrees until finished.
Preparation Tip
You can store curry pastes in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks, or until needed.
When ready to use, add more coconut milk to make a sauce, then add your other ingredients.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Tom Yam Soup with Mushrooms
ingredients: 2-3 sprigs of coriander (hara dhania) for garnish
instructions: Place together the stock, lime leaves, lemon grass, ginger, coriander leaves and onions and bring to a boil.
Simmer for 10 minutes, then add the mushrooms, salt, soya sauce, chilli paste and sugar.
When it comes to a boil, add the milk, lemon juice and chillies, bring to a boil again
Serve garnished with the coriander sprigs.

name: Seared Duck, Thai Red Curry & Crispy Basil
instructions: Season duck breast with oyster sauce and sear in hot pan.
Bake in oven at 125 C for about 10 minutes. Remove and cut into small slices.
In a pan, heat oil and saute pea eggplant.
Add Thai red chilli paste and saute till it leaves oil.
Add fish sauce and sugar followed by coconut milk.
Add kafir lime leaves, bamboo shoots.
Adjust seasoning and finish with fresh basil leaves.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
For Plating:
Pour curry in a pasta platter and arrange duck slices on top.
Garnish with some fried basil.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Miso Coconut Basa
instructions: Take some garlic, ginger, kafir lime leaves, sugar, lemon zest, miso paste and coconut milk in a bowl and mix it well.
Take basa fish and cut it into slices.
Marinate the basa fish slices in the mixture.
Put the marinated basa fish in oven at 190 degree Celsius for 20 minutes and your dish is ready.

name: Green Papaya Salad With Mango Dressing
instructions: Peel ribbons of green papaya and slice the cucumber into thin strips.
Put in the spring onions along with the lime zest.
Add one chopped chilli.
Cut the red bell peppers into thin strips and add them to the other vegetables.
Put the mango pulp in a mixer with rice wine vinegar, coriander leaves, mint leaves and olive oil, and give it a good mix.
Season the salad with some salt and lime juice and pour the mango dressing and serve.

name: Oriental Basil Chicken
instructions: Crush some garlic, green chillies and red chillies together.
Heat the pan with oil for few minutes.
Add the smashed garlic and chillies in the preheated pan. When garlic starts to turn brown, add the chicken and stir for a few minutes.
The juice from the chicken will eventually start coming out. Keep stirring until all the juice is absorbed. It will take a couple of minutes.
Add oyster sauce and light soya sauce. Then add basil leaves to it.
Quickly turn it over a few times to mix the leaves with the meat and then add castor sugar to it.
Mix it well for few minutes and remove from the fire.
Serve hot.

name: Stir Fried Greens
instructions: Cut fennel bulb in half and remove the core.
Thinly slice the fennel and put it in a bowl of chilled water.
Blanch the green beans and cluster beans in boiling hot water for about a minute.
Take them out and put them in a bowl of ice cold water, leave it for about a minute and drain.
In a hot pan, add olive oil and sauté the chopped lemongrass and garlic for a few secs.
Add the sliced fennel, green beans and cluster beans, mix well.
Add the light soy sauce, Guilin chilli sauce, balsamic vinegar and salt and toss it all together.
Finally, stir in the cream and cook for half a minute.
Garnish with pickled ginger and parsley and serve hot.

name: Thai Steamed Fish
instructions: In a steamer put the fish fillets in a bowl. Scatter galangal, fresh lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, fish sauce, red chillies, and steam till it cooks through.
Meanwhile, heat the oil in a pan, brown the garlic and add spring onions for 30 seconds.
Pour the light soya sauce and fish sauce and add the brown sugar. Add lime juice right at the end.
Pour this sauce over the fish when it is steamed. Also pour the leftover liquid from the bowl.
Serve while piping hot.

name: Yellow Thai Curry
ingredients: 4-5 new baby potatoes, cut in half
1 cup french beans, cut in half
A few lime leaves for garnish
A handful of fresh coriander, roughly chopped
instructions: Grind all the ingredients for the paste together.
Soak the sweet potatoes, small new potatoes and plantains in salted water for 10 mins, to prevent oxidization
Then drain the water and season them with a pinch of salt and red chilli powder.
Heat 1 tbsp of vegetable oil in a pan and saute the seasoned veggies for about a minute.
Add the freshly made paste and mix well till it coats the vegetables completely.
Add 1/2 cup of water, give it a nice stir, cover and let it simmer for 2 minutes.
Then add the sliced baby corn, coconut milk, rice wine vinegar and brown sugar. Mix well
Next, add the pea eggplants, beans and frozen green peas.
Stir well, add more water and let it cook till the gravy thickens.
Garnish the curry with fine strips of Kaffir lime leaves.
Serve with steamed rice.

name: Braised Plantain with Thai Spices
ingredients: 1/2 each green and red bell peppers
instructions: Make a wet paste with the bell peppers, green chilies, coriander leaves, grated coconut, cumin seeds, jaggery and tamarind pulp.
Peel the plantains and soak in salted water.
Pat dry, add a pinch of turmeric and red chili powder.
Fry for 5 minutes in a hot pan, drain off excess oil and set aside.
In the same pan, add the shallots and ginger and sweat.
Add the wet paste and fry well.
Add a little water or stock to create sauce.
Add the plantains and simmer till they are cooked perfectly but not mushy.
Serve with noodles or rice.

name: Salt Crusted Baked Snapper
ingredients: 1 Tbsp oil 1 medium size red snapper (whole, gutted)

A small bunch coriander stems 2 tsp fish sauce 1 cup water 1 kg salt For the Sauce:  150 gm jaggery 30 ml fish sauce1 stalk lemon grass 2 lime leaves 2 tsp coriander leaves (chopped) 3/4 cup water 2 small red chillies For Garnish:  1 carrots (fine julienne) 1  bell pepper (julienne ) 1/2 green mango (julienne) 1 medium size daikon radish 2 tsp peanut oil  1 clove garlic/ginger Salt & pepper (to taste)1 cucumber
instructions: For the Fish:
Wash, gut and pat dry the whole fish. Stuff the cavity of the fish with all the ingredients except the fish sauce and lemon juice.
Whisk the lemon juice and fish sauce together, add the oil to it and pour the dressing over the fish.
Coat the fish with a kilo of salt and bake for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
For the Sauce:
In a pot, combine all the ingredients, simmer till thick. Add the chopped fresh coriander leaves.
Garnish With:
Heat the oil and very quickly stir fry the vegetables. Serve on top of the fish.

name: Prawns in Coconut Milk and Coriander
instructions: For the paste:
In a processor blend together all the paste ingredients. Keep aside.
For the prawns:
In a pan heat oil. Saute spring onions.
Add the paste, honey and fish sauce and the prawns. Let it cook.
Add the coconut milk and coconut water. Let it simmer.
Add lime juice and cream.
Garnish with coriander and serve with steamed rice.

name: Poached Prawns in Tropical Fruit Salsa
ingredients: 1 kiwi fruit 1 small papayaMusk melon Salt & pepper to tasteBasil leaves to garnish2 Tbsp sweet chilly sauce 1 coriander leavesJuice of 1 lemon500 ml water
instructions: In a pot take 500ml water and bring it to a boil. Add  coriander leaves and the juice of 1 lemon and poach the prawns in it.  In a glass bowl diced the kiwi fruit, papaya, melons and some spring onions.  Scoop out the flesh of a coconut into a processor and add some sweet chilly sauce and blend well to make a fine puree.  Mix the puree into the bowl of fruits and dice in some of the poached prawns to the salsa.  Serve in martini glasses and garnish with basil leaves.

name: Pineapple Chutney
ingredients: 2 tsp chopped spring onions, to garnish
instructions: In a pan mix together vinegar and sugar. Let it reduce.
Add lemongrass, star anise, cinnamon, kafir lime leaves, lime juice, peppercorns, garlic, ginger and mix well.
Once the mixture starts to thicken add the pineapple pieces. Cook for 1 more minute.
Finish with the chopped spring onions and chopped coriander.
Serve with Thai fish cakes.

name: Thai Fish Cakes with Pineapple Chutney
ingredients: 1 fillet of firm white fish, diced
1 stalk of spring onions, finely chopped
40-50 gm bread crumbs + Bread crumbs to coat the fish cakes
instructions: In a bowl add diced fish pieces, green beans, spring onions, coriander, lemon juice, lime leaf, fish sauce, lemongrass, Thai curry paste, egg and 40-50 gms of bread crumbs. Mix.
Add this in a food processor or mixie. Take this mixture and shape into balls, flatten into cakes.
Roll in bread crumbs. Shallow fry in hot oil.
Serve with a sweet pineapple chutney.

name: Two Sea Food Soup
instructions: Boil the stock for 2-3 minutes in a bowl.
Add the diced prawn and crab.
Stir and add egg white to this followed by salt.
Keep stirring and add cornflour to make the soup thick.
Serve hot.

name: Battered Vegetables with Thai sauce
ingredients: 1 kg assorted vegetables cut into medium sized pieces
instructions: Combine egg yolks, flour, water and salt. Stir well to make a smooth batter.
Dust the vegetables with flour before dipping into the batter.
Deep fry in oil until crisp and golden.
For the sauce:
Heat oil in a pan. Add fish sauce, ginger and chillies.   Sauté until soft. Remove from the heat.   Add coriander, sugar, and soya sauce and lemon juice.
Serve the sauce along with battered vegetables

name: Peanut Rice Cakes
instructions: Combine garlic, ginger, turmeric, sugar, salt, sauces, coriander and lemon juice.
Stir in 75 gm of the rice and pound until smooth.
Stir in the remaining rice.
Shape small balls out of the rice mixture and coat with chopped peanuts.
Deep fry the rice balls until crisp and golden.

name: Thai Egg Fried Rice
instructions: Heat 1 Tbsp of oil in a large frying pan and add egg. Swirl, till set. Remove from pan and cut into strips and keep aside.
Heat the rest of the oil in the same pan and add garlic and spring onions. Saute over high heat till glossy and add rice.
Stir-fry over high heat till rice is heated through.   Add fish sauce, coriander and omelette strips and mix well.
Serve garnished with the cucumber.
NOTE: You can cook this with or without the Fish Sauce.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Crabs in Red Chilli Paste
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add red chilli paste. Then add all the ingredients one by one.  Finally, fry the crabs for a few minutes.

name: Tangy Prawns with Kiwi Salad
instructions: Combine orange segments with prawns, kiwi, nuts and herbs. Season.
Whisk together dressing ingredients.
Mix with prawns and fruit.  Chill.
Flatten bread slices with a rolling pin.
Beat the butter, rind, herbs and pepper together.
Spread over the mushrooms.
Roll up the bread.
Chill well before serving

name: Lettuce Wrapped Cottage Cheese
ingredients: 1/2 yellow bell pepper cut in strips
1/2 red bell pepper cut in strips
Crushed chives to tie the wrap
instructions: In a bowl, mix cottage cheese, red and yellow peppers, Thai chilli sauce, roasted garlic, crushed peanut, pepper corns and chopped chives.
Spread the mixture on the lettuce leaf and wrap.
Tie with the chive and serve.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
Note: Pink peppercorn is a dried berry and is used as a culinary spice. Green peppercorn is the dried unripe fruit which is cooked to make the black peppercorns which we commonly use.

name: Egg and Cabbage Salad
ingredients: 6 hard boiled eggs - shelled and deep fried
instructions: Mix together fish sauce, lime juice and rind and coconut milk.   This the sauce, keep aside.
Combine jaggery, fish sauce and tamarind in a pan.
Simmer for 5 minutes.     Heat oil in a pan and saute onions.
Add garlic and chillies until golden brown. This the onion mixture.
In a bowl place the shredded cabbage. Quarter eggs and arrange over cabbage salad.
Drizzle the sauce.   And scatter with onion mixture.
Garnish with coriander and peanuts.

name: Thai Chilli Broccoli Salad
ingredients: For the chilli vinaigrette:1 Tbsp lemon juice
instructions: Whisk all vinaigrette ingredients together.
Leave for 2 to 3 hours.
Combine curd topping with ingredients and season well.
Before serving, pour the Vinaigrette over the broccoli and top with curd dressing and orange segment.
cook_time: 15 Minutes + Time for setting the dressing (3hrs)

name: Thai Beef Salad
ingredients: 1 stalk of lemon grass - finely chopped
4 red chillies - finely sliced to garnish
instructions: Pan-fry beef steaks until medium-rare.
Allow them to cool completely.
Slice them thin and pack in a box.
Add sliced onion, cucumber, chopped lemon grass and spring onions.
At the picnic site, toss and season with lime juice and Thai fish sauce.
Serve garnished with chillies, coriander, mustard cress and mint.

name: Bean Sprout Salad
instructions: Toss salad items together.
Whisk the dressing ingredients and pour over salad.
Season well and serve.

name: Thai Red Curry Paste
instructions: Grind all the ingredients in a mortar or a food processor using a little water.
Store in an airtight container or in the refrigerator.
Alternatively, freeze for upto 3 months. Use as required.

name: Chicken in Lettuce
ingredients: 350 gm chicken breast - boned and skinned
instructions: Slice chicken into slivers.
Mix with salt, egg white, corn flour and five spice powder.
Heat oil, stir-fry chicken until lightly colored.
Remove from pan and drain.
Add bean sprouts to the oil, followed by bell peppers.
Heat through over a fast flame.
Stir in chicken. Season. Moisten with stock.
Place a spoonful over each lettuce leaf.
Roll into a parcel and serve.
To prepare the sauce:
Combine all ingredients and serve with the lettuce parcels.

name: Thai Green Coconut Curry
instructions: Place the chicken in a pan with hot coconut milk, stock and lime leaves.
Simmer for 10 minutes, remove the chicken form the pan and reduce the gravy over a moderate flame.
Grind the spices with chillies, sugar, salt, lemon grass, ginger, garlic and onions until smooth.
Add coriander, mint, nutmeg and oil to the paste.
Add 4 Tbsp of curry paste and the potatoes to the gravy and simmer.
Replace the chicken and serve hot.

name: Red Cooked Chicken
instructions: Combine all ingredients except the chicken in a deep pan.
Bring to a boil.
Place chicken, breast side down in the pan.
Simmer the chicken until tender, turning and basting at regular intervals.
Remove from the pan and serve with the sauce and salad.
Serve with bean sprout salad.

name: Baked Thai Chicken
ingredients: 1 chicken with skin cut into 8 pieces
Lemon wedges and sliced red chillies
instructions: To make the marinade, blend all ingredients together.
Pour over the chicken pieces and leave for 3-4 hours.
Bake chicken on rack over a baking tin at 200 C for 25 minutes. Baste regularly with marinade.
To prepare the vegetables:
Heat the oil in a large pan. Stir-fry chillies, spring onions and ginger for 1 minute.
Add remaining vegetables and fry for 2 minutes.
Season well, sprinkle on the sugar and pour in the stock.
Serve with the chicken, garnished with lemon wedges and red chillies.

name: Thai Green Chicken Curry
ingredients: 10 gm shrimp paste salt to taste
instructions: For the green curry paste:
Grind all ingredients together to a fine paste.
For the chicken:
Heat the oil and saute green curry paste.
Add diced boneless chicken breast and cook further.
Add coconut milk, sugar, bird chillies, salt and makrut leaves and simmer till the chicken is tender.
Finally add the sweet basil leaves.
Serve the green chicken curry hot with rice.

name: Prawn and Sugarcane
instructions: To prepare the sauce, heat oil in a pan and saute garlic.
Add chicken stock, Hoisin sauce and peanut butter.
Cook for five min and keep aside.
Cut and clean the prawns.
Grind them to a smooth paste.
Add egg white, sugar, salt and pepper and mix well.
Now add cornflour.
Roll this prawn mixture on top of the sugar cane stick in a lollipop shape.
Deep fry the prawn stick until golden in colour or till done.
Serve with the sauce and spring onions.

name: Chicken Lemon Grass Chilli
instructions: Mix the chicken with corn flour, salt and pepper and deep fry it till it is half done. Keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan, add garlic, red chilli, lemon grass and curry powder and sauté it well.
Add the chicken stock and then the fried chicken. Add sugar, salt and pepper and mix well.
Add green onions and corn flour and cook for five minutes or till done.
Garnish it with chopped green onion and serve.

name: Tom Yum Soup
instructions: Take a deep pan, add the stock, lemon grass and galangal and bring it to a boil.
Then add the fresh prawns and mushrooms.
Reduce the flame and stir gently.
As the prawns start turning pink, add the Thai chillies and kafir lime leaves.
Stir again and add the lime juice and fish sauce, which gives a salty flavour.
Boil for 30 seconds and serve hot.

name: Corn Cakes with Sweet Chilli sauce
ingredients: 1 cup sweet corn - boiled and crushed
For the Sweet Chilli Sauce:1/2 cup sugar
instructions: Take a bowl and mix whole corn and crushed corn properly.
Make a paste of Thai coriander root, garlic and white pepper corn.
Add 1 tbsp of the paste to the corn mixture followed by the sugar and add salt.
Add the seasoning sauce and soya sauce. Add the rice flour for binding.
Mix all the ingredients thoroughly. Heat the oil in a deep pan.
Make small balls of the corn mixture and deep fry till golden brown.
To prepare the sweet chilli sauce, grind all the ingredients well.
Serve the corn cakes with the sweet chilli sauce.

name: Green Curry Chicken
ingredients: In a mortar pound all the ingredients together until a soft paste forms.
In a large pan, boil all the ingredients together and simmer until reduced by about one fifth.
2 cans of coconut milk or 1/2 a fresh coconut - shredded
2 lemon grass sticks cut in 1 inch length
3-4 small red or green chilies - sliced
instructions: Heat the oil, add the curry paste, briefly stir then add the coconut milk and stir well.
Add the aubergines, mushrooms and chicken pieces in turn, stirring constantly.
Now add the sugar and vegetable stock, stir and add the cornflour to thicken.
Cook on slow fire for some time and then mix in the lemon grass and kaffir lime leaves.
Once the chicken is done, stir in the chillies and Thai basil leaves, bring to a boil and serve.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.

Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Green Papaya Salad
ingredients: 1/2 green papaya - finely shredded  into long strands and soaked in ice cold water
*You may add more water and jaggery according to taste
instructions: In a mortar, lightly pound the garlic, add the chillies and lightly pound again.
Add the jaggery, lemon juice and soy sauce, pound to a paste.
Add the roasted peanuts and lightly pound while occasionally stirring with a spoon to prevent the paste from thickening.
Now add the tomato, stir, then add the long beans and slightly bruise them.
Add the shredded papaya, lightly pound and stir until all the ingredients have blended together.
Arrange on a serving dish and garnish with crushed peanuts.

name: Pad Thai (Fried Noodles)
ingredients: 120 gm dry sen lek noodles (flat noodles) - soaked in water for 20 minutes, then drained
instructions: In a wok or skillet, heat the oil until a light haze appears.
Add the garlic and fry till golden brown.
Add the tofu and stir briefly.
Break the eggs into the wok mixing quickly while they cook.
Add the noodles, mix well, then add the spring onions, half the amount of peanuts and beansprouts.
Stir well then add the lemon juice, sugar, chilli powder and light Soy sauce.
Mix it up, plate it and garnish with more peanuts.
On the side, arrange the remaining beansprouts leftover peanuts and spring onions with the lemon wedge.

name: Vegetable Thai Red Curry
ingredients: Fresh vegetables (red bell pepper, broccoli, cauliflower, snow peas, zucchini and bamboo shoots) - simmered in an aromatic coconut milk broth.
1 sweet red bell pepper - cut into strips
Broccoli (about one small head) - cut into bite-size florets
Cauliflower (approx. 1/4 head) - cut into bite-size florets
1 small zucchini - cut into julienne strips 2 inches long and 1/8 inch thick
2 Tbsp bamboo shoots - cut into strips
instructions: Heat oil in a large soup pot or sauce pan over medium high heat.
Add curry paste, mashing with the back of a spoon, and saute until fragrant, about one minute.
Add broccoli and cauliflower and mix well to coat with curry paste.
Stir-fry for two minutes.
Add bell pepper and stir-fry for two minutes.
Add coconut milk and stir.
Bring to a boil and then turn down heat to let simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add zucchini and bamboo shoots and simmer for five more minutes. Stir gently.

name: Lemongrass Chicken
ingredients: A bunch of fresh lemon grass
instructions: Marinate the chicken in lemon juice, ginger paste, garlic paste, salt and pepper.
Heat some oil in a non stick pan, add the chicken marinade and stir for a few minutes.
Drop in the lemon grass, mix and add the water.
Cover and simmer for about 20 minutes or till chicken is done.
Now add the honey, mix well and cover again for a few minutes.
Serve the chicken with a lemon wedge.

name: Thai Yellow Curry Paste
ingredients: 2 kaffir lime leaves - snipped into small pieces with scissors
instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend well to a paste.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to two weeks (or longer).
To use right away, place paste in a wok with some vegetable oil.
Stir fry until fragrant (about one minute), then add some coconut milk plus some more lemongrass stalk.
Add meat, chicken or tofu or vegetables and cook till tender.

name: Chicken Satay with Peanut Sauce
ingredients: For Chicken Marinade:1 boneless chicken - diced
instructions: For Chicken Marinade:
Marinate the chicken for at least two hours.
Then pierce 4-5 pieces of chicken per skewer.
For Peanut Sauce:
Grind the onion, chillies and garlic together.

Heat oil in a pan and saute the onion paste for some time. Mix in the peanut butter, add salt and sugar and stir. Pour in water and cook until you get a smooth sauce. Add lemon juice and switch off the gas.
For Basting Sauce:
Mix the peanut sauce with the oil and soya sauce.
For Satay:
Pan grill the chicken. When done, cover it with the basting sauce. Let it cook for some time.
Serve hot with peanut sauce.

name: Thai Green Curry Paste
instructions: Grind all the ingredients in a mortar or a food processor using a little water.
Store in an airtight container or in the refrigerator.
Alternatively, freeze for up to three months. Use as required.
